Description: alternative Hippocampal sclerosis (simplified). Infarcted and minimal or focal neuronal loss in the Hippocampus is most often associated with TDP-43 so it will be not considered as presence of Hippocampal sclerosis. Neuronal loss epilepsy-related (endplate) or Lewy-related (CA2) will be not considered as presence of Hippocampal sclerosis.
Normal neuronal population or Focal/Patchy neuronal loss in all sectors of Ammon's horn or Sommer' s sector
Marked/Severe/Extensive/Moderate neuronal loss in all sectors of Ammon's horn or Sommer' s sector
